snippet: The most immediate result of an agreement, which came more than three months after the massacre of 26 children and educators in Newtown, was a rush to buy weapons.
abstract: Connecticut residents rush to buy weapons, ammunition and magazines after agreement by state legislature on stricter gun-control laws; many feel new legislation will punish law-abiding citizens but legislators, many Sandy Hook Elementary School families, gun-control groups and big-city mayors praise it.

byline.contributor: Robert Davey, Elizabeth Maker and Vivian Yee contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The most immediate result of an agreement, which came more than three months after the massacre of 26 children and educators in Newtown, was a rush to buy weapons.

headline.seo: Connecticut Prepares for Consequences of New Gun Laws
headline.main: Legislative Deal Prompts Run on Connecticut Gun Shops
headline.print_headline: Legislative Deal Prompts Run on Connecticut Gun Shops
